title: Pope Benedict XVI to Resign February 28
post: I would be very surprise if the Shroud would be on the top-10 list of priorities of the new pope (which I hope will bring a bit of fresh air to the Vatican).  You can bet your house that this newcommer will have much more important things to fix and to reflect upon than to think about the Shroud of Turin. Also, let’s not forget that the next public exhibition of the Shroud is only planned for 2025 and I would be very surprise if a new series of direct test on the cloth would be allowed before that time.  While we wait for this day to come, I think the first intelligent step for the Church would be to put together an international team of credible and UNBIASED imagery experts in order to analyse properly the high-resolution photos that were taken in 2000 and 2002 and publish a scientific report on that…
author: Yannick Clément
